intro: Gerbera viridifolia, commonly known as the greenleaf gerbera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Its foliage is dark green and lance-shaped, adding to its ornamental appeal. Gerbera viridifolia is often cultivated for its vibrant blooms and is suitable for gardens and containers.
